text: Paracroton zeylanicus is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae that is endemic to south-western parts of Sri Lanka. It was first found from a Hinidumkanda Biosphere Reserve, but rapidly declined due to deforestation and other anthropogenic activities. The plant is listed as a critically endangered by IUCN.http://iucnredlist.org/details/33513/0 ==References== Category:Crotoneae Category:Endemic flora of Sri Lanka Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot Category:Plants described in 1864
title: Paracroton zeylanicus
